original: // / dben par gnag pas 'greng na'o //
analyzed: // / dben par gnag pas 'greng na'o //
translated: One should not eat food that is harmful to one‚Äôs health.

original: skyabs yod par ro //
analyzed: skyabs yod par ro //
translated: One should

original: gal te 'jigs pa'i dbang gis ma yin na'o //
analyzed: gal te 'jigs pa'i dbang gis ma yin na'o //
translated: except if it is out of fear.

original: tshor bya dag dang tshor byed gnyis kyis mtshor na nyes byas kyi'o //
analyzed: tshor bya dag dang tshor byed gnyis kyis mtshor na nyes byas kyi'o //
translated: If the monk and the woman are both receptive, the offense is a serious transgression.

original: gnas gzhan la sems gtod pa yang ngo //
analyzed: gnas gzhan la sems gtod pa yang ngo //
translated: The monk is also at fault if he directs his thoughts to another place.

original: 'di la mthong ba'i spyod yul gyi mtha' tshun chad ni gnas kyi mtha' yin no //
analyzed: 'di la mthong ba'i spyod yul gyi mtha' tshun chad ni gnas kyi mtha' yin no //
translated: The limit of the range of vision is the limit of the place.

original: mdzod ni khongs su gtogs pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: mdzod ni khongs su gtogs pa nyid yin no //
translated: The house is included in the place.

original: khyim gzhan ni tha dad pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: khyim gzhan ni tha dad pa nyid yin no //
translated: Another house is a different place.

original: nyal po byed par shom pa'i khyim na 'greng ba'i ltung byed do /
analyzed: nyal po byed par shom pa'i khyim na 'greng ba'i ltung byed do /
translated: Standing in a house where people are having sex is a downfall.

original: // / pho yang rung mo yang rung ba la'o //
analyzed: // / pho yang rung mo yang rung ba la'o //
translated: The person may be a man or a woman.

original: nye du dang rab tu byung ba la ltos pa dang nad pa ma gtogs so //
analyzed: nye du dang rab tu byung ba la ltos pa dang nad pa ma gtogs so //
translated: The exception is if the monk is related to the people, or if he is a renunciate, or if he is sick.

original: rtags 'di dang rab tu byung ba 'di med pa'i gcer bu'o //
analyzed: rtags 'di dang rab tu byung ba 'di med pa'i gcer bu'o //
translated: The monk is naked, and there is no sign of a renunciate.

original: lus sam lus dang 'brel par ro //üîΩbca' bar bya ba dang bza' bar bya bdag go //
analyzed: lus sam lus dang 'brel par ro // bca' bar bya ba dang bza' bar bya bdag go //
translated: The monk touches the body or something attached to the body.

original: rung bag go //
analyzed: rung bag go //
translated: The monk touches something that is being prepared to eat or something that is being eaten.

original: rang dang de la'o //
analyzed: rang dang de la'o //
translated: The monk touches the body or something attached to the body.üîΩThe monk touches the body or something attached to the body.

original: sdig pa can gyi lta ba'i rnam pa dang dbral ba nyid kyi phyir ma gtogs so //
analyzed: sdig pa can gyi lta ba'i rnam pa dang dbral ba nyid kyi phyir ma gtogs so //
translated: Except if it is to free them from a sinful view.

original: rang gis sbyin na'o //
analyzed: rang gis sbyin na'o //
translated: If he gives it himself.

original: mi rung bdag ni nyes byas so //
analyzed: mi rung bdag ni nyes byas so //
translated: If he gives it to someone else, saying, ‚ÄúIt is not right for me to commit a misdeed.‚Äù

original: sbyin du 'jug na yang ngo //
analyzed: sbyin du 'jug na yang ngo //
translated: If he makes someone else give it.

original: rang gis zhal ta byas na'o //üîΩbgo bsha' byed na yang ngo //
analyzed: rang gis zhal ta byas na'o // bgo bsha' byed na yang ngo //
translated: If he himself does the work.üîΩIf he distributes it.

original: gcer bu la sbyin pa'i ltung byed do /
analyzed: gcer bu la sbyin pa'i ltung byed do /
translated: The downfall is accrued by the monk who gives the robe to a naked ascetic.

original: // / g-yul la mngon par dga' ba'i dmag dag la lta ba'i don nyid kyis so //
analyzed: // / g-yul la mngon par dga' ba'i dmag dag la lta ba'i don nyid kyis so //
translated: The downfall is accrued by watching a battle out of mere curiosity.

original: rgyal po dang btsun mo dang gzhon nu dang zhang blon dang khrom gyi ru sna dang grong rdal gyi mi dang ljongs kyi mis bkug pa dang bar chad byung ba'i dbang nyid ma gtogs so //
analyzed: rgyal po dang btsun mo dang gzhon nu dang zhang blon dang khrom gyi ru sna dang grong rdal gyi mi dang ljongs kyi mis bkug pa dang bar chad byung ba'i dbang nyid ma gtogs so //
translated: Except if the monk is summoned by the king, queen, prince, minister, general, townspeople, or country people, or if he is obliged to go because of an obstacle.

original: 'phags pa'i nye 'khor gyi mtha' las @40b 'das te mthong na'o //
analyzed: 'phags pa'i nye 'khor gyi mtha' las @40b 'das te mthong na'o //
translated: If he goes beyond the boundary of the vicinity of the noble ones.

original: dmag la lta ba'i ltung byed do /
analyzed: dmag la lta ba'i ltung byed do /
translated: The downfall is accrued by watching a battle.

original: // / de dag med par nyin mtshan nyid las lhag par 'dug na'o //
analyzed: // / de dag med par nyin mtshan nyid las lhag par 'dug na'o //
translated: The downfall is accrued by staying more than one day and night in the absence of necessity.

original: dgos pa med na snga ma la yang ngo //
analyzed: dgos pa med na snga ma la yang ngo //
translated: If there is no necessity, the downfall is accrued by the first night.

original: dmag gi nang na 'dug pa'i ltung byed do /
analyzed: dmag gi nang na 'dug pa'i ltung byed do /
translated: There is an offense for one who is in the army.

original: // / dpung gi yan lag rnams ni byed pa po nyid do //
analyzed: // / dpung gi yan lag rnams ni byed pa po nyid do //
translated: The limbs of the army are the agents themselves.

original: bar chad kyi dbang gis 'gro ba ma yin pa la'o //
analyzed: bar chad kyi dbang gis 'gro ba ma yin pa la'o //
translated: It is not when one goes because of an obstacle.

original: bsdus pa dang so so ba dag go //
analyzed: bsdus pa dang so so ba dag go //
translated: There are two types: the general and the specific.

original: sta gon byas pa rnams kyi dngos po la dngos gzhi'o //
analyzed: sta gon byas pa rnams kyi dngos po la dngos gzhi'o //
translated: The actual basis is in regard to the things of those who are prepared.

original: sbyor ba la ni nyes byas kyi'o //
analyzed: sbyor ba la ni nyes byas kyi'o //
translated: The offense of wrong conduct is in regard to the preparation.

original: reg pa dang bshams pa dkrugs pa dang lta ba'i phyir 'phags shing nye 'khor gyi mtha' las 'das te mthong ba lta bu ni dngos gzhi dag yin no //
analyzed: reg pa dang bshams pa dkrugs pa dang lta ba'i phyir 'phags shing nye 'khor gyi mtha' las 'das te mthong ba lta bu ni dngos gzhi dag yin no //
translated: The actual basis is when one goes beyond the boundary of the camp in order to touch, or to disturb what has been set up, or to look, as if one were a noble.

original: ma chas pa nyid la ni na smad pa nyid do //
analyzed: ma chas pa nyid la ni na smad pa nyid do //
translated: The offense of censure is when one has not gone.

original: glang po che dang rta dang bya gag dang bya la ba ka dang bya brta ka dang / skyes pa dang bud med 'thab pa la sogs pa bya ba dang byed du gzhug pa dang blta bar mi bya'o //
analyzed: glang po che dang rta dang bya gag dang bya la ba ka dang bya brta ka dang / skyes pa dang bud med 'thab pa la sogs pa bya ba dang byed du gzhug pa dang blta bar mi bya'o //
translated: One should not watch elephants, horses, cocks, quail, men, women, and so on, fighting, nor should one cause others to do so.

original: dpung gi yan lag nyams su myong ba'i ltung byed do /
analyzed: dpung gi yan lag nyams su myong ba'i ltung byed do /
translated: There is an offense for one who experiences the limbs of the army.

original: // / rnyog pa can gyi sems nyid kyis dge slong pha rol la lus sam des 'phangs pa'am de dang 'brel pa dag gang yang rung ba tha na rkang ba'i mthe bo 'am yungs kar ram rtsva dag gis brdegs na'o //
analyzed: // / rnyog pa can gyi sems nyid kyis dge slong pha rol la lus sam des 'phangs pa'am de dang 'brel pa dag gang yang rung ba tha na rkang ba'i mthe bo 'am yungs kar ram rtsva dag gis brdegs na'o //
translated: If, with a disturbed mind, a monk strikes a fellow monk, or throws something at him, or connects him with something, even with the tip of a blade of grass, or a mustard seed, or a piece of straw.

original: gzhan dag la yang ngo//
analyzed: gzhan dag la yang ngo//
translated: Or at others.

original: reg na'o // rdeg spyad re re la'o //
analyzed: reg na'o // rdeg spyad re re la'o //
translated: If he touches them, for each blow.

original: ma phog na nyes byas so //
analyzed: ma phog na nyes byas so //
translated: If he does not hit, then there is an offense of wrong conduct.

original: brdeg par bya ba gzhan yin la gzhan la brdeg par mi bya'o //
analyzed: brdeg par bya ba gzhan yin la gzhan la brdeg par mi bya'o //
translated: One should not strike someone who is to be struck in a place other than where he should be struck.

original: ka ba la brdeg par mi bya'o //
analyzed: ka ba la brdeg par mi bya'o //
translated: One should not strike a pillar.

original: rtsig pa dang sa dang shing ljon pa dang gzhan la yang mi bya'o //üîΩrdeg pa'i ltung byed do /
analyzed: rtsig pa dang sa dang shing ljon pa dang gzhan la yang mi bya'o // rdeg pa'i ltung byed do /
translated: One should not strike a wall, the ground, a tree, or another.üîΩThe downfall of striking.

original: // / brdeg par gzas na'o //
analyzed: // / brdeg par gzas na'o //
translated: If one threatens to strike.

original: rdzas re re la'o //
analyzed: rdzas re re la'o //
translated: For each object.

original: gzas pa'i ltung byed do /
analyzed: gzas pa'i ltung byed do /
translated: The downfall of threatening.

original: // / pham par 'gyur ba dang dge 'dun lhag ma dag bcabs na'o //
analyzed: // / pham par 'gyur ba dang dge 'dun lhag ma dag bcabs na'o //
translated: If one conceals a defeat or a serious offense.

original: bde ba la mi reg pa dang dge sbyong gi tshul dang tshangs par spyod pa'i bar chad dang dge 'dun la khrug tu dogs pa'i dbang nyid ma gtogs par 'chab na'o //
analyzed: bde ba la mi reg pa dang dge sbyong gi tshul dang tshangs par spyod pa'i bar chad dang dge 'dun la khrug tu dogs pa'i dbang nyid ma gtogs par 'chab na'o //
translated: Except if it is in order to avoid a danger to life or to pure conduct, or in order to avoid a schism in the Sangha or a dispute in the Sangha.

original: nyin mtshan gyi mthar ro //
analyzed: nyin mtshan gyi mthar ro //
translated: At the end of the day and night.

original: snga rol du ni nyes byas so //
analyzed: snga rol du ni nyes byas so //
translated: If it is before, there is an offense of wrong conduct.

original: ltung ba gzhan yang ngo //
analyzed: ltung ba gzhan yang ngo //
translated: And also for other downfalls.

original: gnas ngan len 'chab pa'i ltung byed do /üîΩ// / nad kyi gnyen po'i don nyid ma gtogs par ched du bsams te sbyin pa po khyim du zan gcod du bcug na'o //
analyzed: gnas ngan len 'chab pa'i ltung byed do / // / nad kyi gnyen po'i don nyid ma gtogs par ched du bsams te sbyin pa po khyim du zan gcod du bcug na'o //
translated: (The downfall is incurred) by concealing the bad action.

original: @41a * // zan gcod du 'jug pa'i ltung byed do /
analyzed: @41a * // zan gcod du 'jug pa'i ltung byed do /
translated: Except if it is for the sake of curing an illness, if a monk intentionally makes a donor give food to the Sangha and then does not eat it himself, he commits a downfall.

original: // / seng ge la reg par mi bya'o //
analyzed: // / seng ge la reg par mi bya'o //
translated: One should not touch a lion.

original: ston pa chos dang dge 'dun dang tshangs pa mtshungs par spyod pa rnams kyi chos dang ldan pa'i bya ba'i don nyid dang / lhung bzed dang chon gyi las la brtag pa ni dus byin gyis brlabs pa yin no //
analyzed: ston pa chos dang dge 'dun dang tshangs pa mtshungs par spyod pa rnams kyi chos dang ldan pa'i bya ba'i don nyid dang / lhung bzed dang chon gyi las la brtag pa ni dus byin gyis brlabs pa yin no //
translated: Except if it is for the sake of the Dharma or the Sangha, or for the sake of the Dharma of the spiritual friends, or for the sake of the work of the begging-bowl and the robes, it is the right time to give permission.

original: yun ring du byin gyis brlab par bya'o //
analyzed: yun ring du byin gyis brlab par bya'o //
translated: One should give permission for a long time.

original: rtse ba nyid na'o //
analyzed: rtse ba nyid na'o //
translated: when one is playing.üîΩby making it go to another, by making it do the work of the moon, the sun, a firebrand, etc.

original: gzhan la gtong bas zla ba dang nyi ma dang mgal me'i 'khor lo la sogs pa byed pas so //
analyzed: gzhan la gtong bas zla ba dang nyi ma dang mgal me'i 'khor lo la sogs pa byed pas so //
translated: by fire.

original: mes so // dus byin gyis ma brlabs par dge slong na ba'i dbang nyid du gnas pa ma yin pa la reg na'o ;
analyzed: mes so // dus byin gyis ma brlabs par dge slong na ba'i dbang nyid du gnas pa ma yin pa la reg na'o ;
translated: if one touches a sick monk who is not a relative, without having taken precautions.

original: / rang ngam bsgo bas so //
analyzed: / rang ngam bsgo bas so //
translated: by oneself or by having it done.üîΩif one sets fire to, or causes to be set, dry grass, etc.

original: sbar ba dang gsod pa dang reg pa dang / ma reg pa'i bud shing bskul ba dang bcas pa 'dren pa dang mdag ma sbung ba dang 'bru bdag la'o //
analyzed: sbar ba dang gsod pa dang reg pa dang / ma reg pa'i bud shing bskul ba dang bcas pa 'dren pa dang mdag ma sbung ba dang 'bru bdag la'o //
translated: if one throws into a fire half-burned pieces of wood, or if one causes to be carried, or if one throws into a fire pieces of wood that are not splintered, or if one throws into a fire pieces of wood that are not dry.

original: me ma mur ni phyed shi ba nyid do //
analyzed: me ma mur ni phyed shi ba nyid do //
translated: a burning pit is a place where half-burned pieces of wood are thrown.

original: me lce dag kyang ngo //
analyzed: me lce dag kyang ngo //
translated: a flame is a line of fire.

original: der bud shing 'jud pa dang 'byin pa ni me gzhan gyi nyes pa yin no //
analyzed: der bud shing 'jud pa dang 'byin pa ni me gzhan gyi nyes pa yin no //
translated: if one throws dry grass, etc. into it, or if one causes it to be thrown, one commits an offense.

original: skra dang sbu dang rus pa dag dang sen mo dang / mchil ma dang snabs dang skyugs pa dang rlugs pa dang mon sran snge'u dang mon sran gre'u dang til dang 'bru mar dang sbrang rtsi dang mar dag ni bud shing gi phyed nyid do //
analyzed: skra dang sbu dang rus pa dag dang sen mo dang / mchil ma dang snabs dang skyugs pa dang rlugs pa dang mon sran snge'u dang mon sran gre'u dang til dang 'bru mar dang sbrang rtsi dang mar dag ni bud shing gi phyed nyid do //
translated: The samayasthƒÅphula is the samayasthƒÅphula of the other half.üîΩThe samayasthƒÅphula is the samayasthƒÅphula of the other half.üîΩThe samayasthƒÅphula is the samayasthƒÅphula of the other half.üîΩThe samayasthƒÅphula is the samayasthƒÅphula of the other half.üîΩThe samayasthƒÅphula is the samayasthƒÅphula of the other half.üîΩThe samayasthƒÅphula is the samayasthƒÅphula of the other half.üîΩThe samayasthƒÅphula is the samayasthƒÅphula of the other half.üîΩThe samayasthƒÅphula is the samayasthƒÅphula of the other half.üîΩThe samayasthƒÅphula is the samayasthƒÅphula of the other half.

original: gzhan gyi bya ba gzhan la byin gyis rlob pa ni phyed byin gyis brlabs pa yin no //üîΩme la reg pa'i ltung byed do /
analyzed: gzhan gyi bya ba gzhan la byin gyis rlob pa ni phyed byin gyis brlabs pa yin no // me la reg pa'i ltung byed do /
translated: The samayasthƒÅphula is the samayasthƒÅphula of the other half.üîΩThe samayasthƒÅphula is the samayasthƒÅphula of the other half.

original: // / dge slong gi don gyi phyed kyi las byas pa la 'dun pa phul ba la phyir bsgyur ba'i phyir smras na'o //
analyzed: // / dge slong gi don gyi phyed kyi las byas pa la 'dun pa phul ba la phyir bsgyur ba'i phyir smras na'o //
translated: The samayasthƒÅphula is the samayasthƒÅphula of the other half.

original: 'dun pa phyir bsgyur ba'i ltung byed do /
analyzed: 'dun pa phyir bsgyur ba'i ltung byed do /
translated: The samayasthƒÅphula is the samayasthƒÅphula of the other half.üîΩThe samayasthƒÅphula is the samayasthƒÅphula of the other half.üîΩThe samayasthƒÅphula is the samayasthƒÅphula of the other half.

original: // / zla ba dang nyi ma ma gtogs pa'i snang ba dang bcas pa'i gnas kyi phyogs su nyal bar mi bya'o //
analyzed: // / zla ba dang nyi ma ma gtogs pa'i snang ba dang bcas pa'i gnas kyi phyogs su nyal bar mi bya'o //
translated: The samayasthƒÅphula is the samayasthƒÅphula of the other half.

original: nad pa dang nad g-yog gi dbang nyid ma gtogs so //üîΩ'di la kha cig ni ltung byed ce'o //
analyzed: nad pa dang nad g-yog gi dbang nyid ma gtogs so //üîΩ'di la kha cig ni ltung byed ce'o //
translated: The samayasthƒÅphula is the samayasthƒÅphula of the other half.üîΩThe samayasthƒÅphula is the samayasth

original: nyal ba ma yin pa ni phyed nyid do //
analyzed: nyal ba ma yin pa ni phyed nyid do //
translated: The other half is not sleeping.

original: nyin mo tha dad pa nyid kyang ngo //üîΩphal cher g-yogs pa dang bskor ba ni gnas kyi mtha' yin no //
analyzed: nyin mo tha dad pa nyid kyang ngo // phal cher g-yogs pa dang bskor ba ni gnas kyi mtha' yin no //
translated: And also during the day, when they are separate.üîΩThe boundary of the dwelling is where it is mostly covered and enclosed.

original: de'i sgo ngos dang 'brel ba'i nye 'khor gnas su gyur pa ni de'i khongs su gtogs pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: de'i sgo ngos dang 'brel ba'i nye 'khor gnas su gyur pa ni de'i khongs su gtogs pa nyid yin no //
translated: The courtyard connected to the door of the dwelling is also included in the dwelling.

original: khyer gzhan bar ma chod pa sgo de dang 'brel ba yang ngo //
analyzed: khyer gzhan bar ma chod pa sgo de dang 'brel ba yang ngo //
translated: And also the other courtyard connected to that door, if it is not separated by another courtyard.

original: nye 'khor dang bcas pa nas gnas khang tsam gyi pha rol na tha dad par gyur cing gnas pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: nye 'khor dang bcas pa nas gnas khang tsam gyi pha rol na tha dad par gyur cing gnas pa ni ma yin no //
translated: But if it is separated by another courtyard, then it is not included in the dwelling.

original: shing ljon pa'i drung dang rtsig pa'i bar dang @41b tshang tshing gi drung dag ni phyed nyid do //
analyzed: shing ljon pa'i drung dang rtsig pa'i bar dang @41b tshang tshing gi drung dag ni phyed nyid do //
translated: The foot of a tree, a wall, and a thicket are half the size.

original: thibs po dang bcas pa dag tu bud med dang lhan cig nyal ba yang ngo //
analyzed: thibs po dang bcas pa dag tu bud med dang lhan cig nyal ba yang ngo //
translated: And also if one sleeps with a woman in a place with thick cover.

original: 'di la bya gag 'phur nas babs par gyur pa'i lam ni bar du chod par gyur pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: 'di la bya gag 'phur nas babs par gyur pa'i lam ni bar du chod par gyur pa nyid yin no //
translated: In this case, the path where a chicken would fly down is the boundary.

original: nang gcig tu rgyu zhing bar na gnas gzhan med pa ma yin pa can nyid la ni g-yogs pa thams cad gcig pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: nang gcig tu rgyu zhing bar na gnas gzhan med pa ma yin pa can nyid la ni g-yogs pa thams cad gcig pa nyid yin no //
translated: In the case of a single room, there is no other place in between, and the whole room is considered to be one place.

original: rang gi char gtogs pa'i sgo bcad pas bcad pa la ni nye 'khor yang tha dad pa nyid do //
analyzed: rang gi char gtogs pa'i sgo bcad pas bcad pa la ni nye 'khor yang tha dad pa nyid do //
translated: In the case of a room divided into sections by walls, the sections are considered to be separate places.

original: ltung ba 'byin par byed pa dge slong gis bsrungs pa nyid dang bud med bdag pos bsrungs pa nyid ni de dang 'dra'o //üîΩrim khang gzhan la ni skas steng du brtul ba nyid do //
analyzed: ltung ba 'byin par byed pa dge slong gis bsrungs pa nyid dang bud med bdag pos bsrungs pa nyid ni de dang 'dra'o // rim khang gzhan la ni skas steng du brtul ba nyid do //
translated: The case of a nun who is protected by a monk is similar to the case of a woman who is protected by her husband.üîΩIn the case of a room with a balcony, the balcony is considered to be a separate place.

original: gzhan gnas ma yin pa nyid la ni na smad do //
analyzed: gzhan gnas ma yin pa nyid la ni na smad do //
translated: In the case of a room with a raised floor, the raised floor is considered to be a separate place.

original: bsnyen par ma rdzogs pa dang lhan cig gnas gcig tu mtshan mo gsum pa la nyal na'o //
analyzed: bsnyen par ma rdzogs pa dang lhan cig gnas gcig tu mtshan mo gsum pa la nyal na'o //
translated: If an unordained person spends three nights in the same room as a fully ordained monk,

original: mthar ro // mdun rol du ni nyes byas so //
analyzed: mthar ro // mdun rol du ni nyes byas so //
translated: the monk commits an offense.

original: lam gyis dub pa rmya ba la ni nyes pa med do //
analyzed: lam gyis dub pa rmya ba la ni nyes pa med do //
translated: If the monk is traveling and is exhausted, there is no offense.

original: mthar yang de bzhin no //
analyzed: mthar yang de bzhin no //
translated: The same is true for the end of the night.

original: dge slong gis byar mi rung ba yod na de sgrub par byed pa dang lhan cig pa'i nad pa dang nad g-yog la yang ngo //
analyzed: dge slong gis byar mi rung ba yod na de sgrub par byed pa dang lhan cig pa'i nad pa dang nad g-yog la yang ngo //
translated: If there is a monk who is not fit to do it, then also for the sick and the nurse who are together with him.

original: dge tshul dang yang ngo //
analyzed: dge tshul dang yang ngo //
translated: Also for the novice monk.

original: de dang ldan pa de la'o //
analyzed: de dang ldan pa de la'o //
translated: It is for him who possesses that.

original: gnas de na dge slong sdig can nye bar gyur pa nyid na'o //
analyzed: gnas de na dge slong sdig can nye bar gyur pa nyid na'o //
translated: It is when a sinful monk is nearby.

original: de sbrugs pa la 'bad pa byas sam byed pa la'o //
analyzed: de sbrugs pa la 'bad pa byas sam byed pa la'o //
translated: It is when he has made an effort to expel him, or is making an effort.

original: gnas par khas blangs na dus phyi ma dang snga ma'i gnyis po dag la bab pa na'o //
analyzed: gnas par khas blangs na dus phyi ma dang snga ma'i gnyis po dag la bab pa na'o //
translated: It is when he has agreed to stay, and the two, the later and the earlier, have arrived.

original: des lhag par gnas par mi bya ba nyid do //
analyzed: des lhag par gnas par mi bya ba nyid do //
translated: He should not stay on.

original: gnas par khas blangs pa snga ma shos mi bya ba nyid do //
analyzed: gnas par khas blangs pa snga ma shos mi bya ba nyid do //
translated: He should not do the earlier agreement to stay.

original: snga ma ni mi bsrung bar bya ba nyid do //
analyzed: snga ma ni mi bsrung bar bya ba nyid do //
translated: The earlier is not to be protected.

original: des dge tshul nye bar ma gzhag pa nye bar gzhag par mi bya'o //
analyzed: des dge tshul nye bar ma gzhag pa nye bar gzhag par mi bya'o //
translated: He should not place the novice monk nearby, if he has not already placed him nearby.

original: lam du dge tshul gnyid bro bas rmya bar gyur na mdun du btang ste 'gro bar bya'o //
analyzed: lam du dge tshul gnyid bro bas rmya bar gyur na mdun du btang ste 'gro bar bya'o //
translated: If the novice monk is tired from sleep on the road, he should be sent ahead and they should go.

original: gal te bru ba tsha par gyur na de la nang par gyi dus su kha zas sbyin par bya'o //
analyzed: gal te bru ba tsha par gyur na de la nang par gyi dus su kha zas sbyin par bya'o //
translated: If he is afflicted with a severe stomachache, he should be given food at the time of the morning meal.

original: gal te dro kar yang na de'i tshe yang ngo //
analyzed: gal te dro kar yang na de'i tshe yang ngo //
translated: If he is afflicted with a stomachache in the afternoon, he should be given food at that time.

original: bsnyen par ma rdzogs pa dang lhan cig nyal ba'i ltung byed do /üîΩ// / ji ltar bcom ldan 'das kyis bar du gcod pa'i chos su gsungs pa gang dag yin pa de dag brten kyang bar du gcod par mi 'gyur ro //üîΩde ltar bcom ldan 'das kyis chos bstan pa bdag gis shes so zhes bya ba la sogs par 'jug @42a * //
analyzed: bsnyen par ma rdzogs pa dang lhan cig nyal ba'i ltung byed do / // / ji ltar bcom ldan 'das kyis bar du gcod pa'i chos su gsungs pa gang dag yin pa de dag brten kyang bar du gcod par mi 'gyur ro // de ltar bcom ldan 'das kyis chos bstan pa bdag gis shes so zhes bya ba la sogs par 'jug @42a * //
translated: The downfall is accrued by the novice monk when he lies down to sleep in the same room as a fully ordained monk.üîΩThe downfall is accrued when one persists in a practice that the Blessed One has declared to be an obstacle to the spiritual life, even though one has been admonished by one‚Äôs preceptor or instructor.üîΩThe downfall is accrued when one persists in using the expression ‚ÄúI understand‚Äù and so forth, even though one has been admonished by the members of the community.

original: pa'i tshig mi gtong ba la'o //
analyzed: pa'i tshig mi gtong ba la'o //
translated: The downfall is accrued when one persists in using the expression ‚ÄúI understand‚Äù and so forth, even though one has been admonished by the members of the community.

original: de la gsol bas smad pa nyid byas te de'i 'og tu'o //
analyzed: de la gsol bas smad pa nyid byas te de'i 'og tu'o //
translated: The downfall is accrued when one persists in a wrong view, even though one has been admonished by the members of the community.

original: lta ba'i rnam pa mi gtong ba'i ltung byed do /üîΩ// / shes gtso'o //
analyzed: lta ba'i rnam pa mi gtong ba'i ltung byed do / // / shes gtso'o //
translated: The downfall is accrued when one persists in refusing to relinquish a wrong view, even though one has been admonished by the members of the community.

original: de skad smra bas spangs pa phyir bcos pa nyid ma byas pa'i dge slong la'o //
analyzed: de skad smra bas spangs pa phyir bcos pa nyid ma byas pa'i dge slong la'o //
translated: The downfall is accrued when one persists in refusing to relinquish a wrong view, even though one has been admonished by the members of the community.

original: lung dbog pa dang dmigs kyis 'dri ba dang gnas dang rjes su bstan pa dang gdams ngag sbyin na'o //
analyzed: lung dbog pa dang dmigs kyis 'dri ba dang gnas dang rjes su bstan pa dang gdams ngag sbyin na'o //
translated: When one gives a scriptural text, when one asks about a point, when one gives a place, when one gives instruction, when one gives advice.

original: lta ba smra na'o //
analyzed: lta ba smra na'o //
translated: When one speaks about the view.

original: zang zing gi longs spyod byed na'o //
analyzed: zang zing gi longs spyod byed na'o //
translated: When one makes use of material goods.

original: bsnyen bkur bdag gir byed na'o //
analyzed: bsnyen bkur bdag gir byed na'o //
translated: When one makes use of service.

original: gnas su lhan cig nyal na yang ngo //
analyzed: gnas su lhan cig nyal na yang ngo //
translated: When one sleeps in the same place as a novice.

original: mthar ro // mtshan mo'i'o //
analyzed: mthar ro // mtshan mo'i'o //
translated: At the end of the night.

original: gzhan gyis bsrul na yang ngo //
analyzed: gzhan gyis bsrul na yang ngo //
translated: When another person is the go-between.

original: nad pa dang lta ba dang dbral bar gtogs pa'i don gyis ni ma gtogs so //
analyzed: nad pa dang lta ba dang dbral bar gtogs pa'i don gyis ni ma gtogs so //
translated: Except when one is trying to separate a novice from a bad view.

original: spangs pa'i rjes su phyogs pa'i ltung byed do /
analyzed: spangs pa'i rjes su phyogs pa'i ltung byed do /
translated: This is the downfall of turning away from the vows of a novice.

original: // / tshig de nyid la zhugs pa mi gtong na dge tshul bsnyil bar bya'o //
analyzed: // / tshig de nyid la zhugs pa mi gtong na dge tshul bsnyil bar bya'o //
translated: If one does not give up the words of a novice, one should be expelled.üîΩ‚ÄúFirst, the proposal and the four-part formal procedure, and then the expulsion.‚Äù

original: khyod la dang por gsol ba dang bzhi'i las dang de'i 'og tu bsnyil ba rtsom mo zhes bya ba dang / gsol ba byas so //
analyzed: khyod la dang por gsol ba dang bzhi'i las dang de'i 'og tu bsnyil ba rtsom mo zhes bya ba dang / gsol ba byas so //
translated: ‚ÄúThe proposal has been made.

original: las brjod pa dang po dang gnyis pa yang byas zin gyi sdig pa can gyi lta ba'i rnam pa 'di lta bu 'di thong shig ces re re'i mthar dge slong gis de la bsgrag par bya'o //
analyzed: las brjod pa dang po dang gnyis pa yang byas zin gyi sdig pa can gyi lta ba'i rnam pa 'di lta bu 'di thong shig ces re re'i mthar dge slong gis de la bsgrag par bya'o //
translated: At the end of each of the first and second recitations, the monk should proclaim to him, ‚ÄúGive up this kind of view, which is sinful and has already been declared to be a downfall.‚ÄùüîΩIf he gives it up, he should not commit it again.

original: btang na phyi ma mi bya'o //üîΩdge tshul bsnyil ba nyid do //
analyzed: btang na phyi ma mi bya'o // dge tshul bsnyil ba nyid do //
translated: He is expelled.

original: bsnyil ba sdud pa'i ltung byed do /üîΩ// / sngon po'am dmar po'am ngur smrig gis kha ma bsgyur ba rang gi gos tha na lhung bzed kyi kha g-yogs dang snod dang rkang pa'i 'bo ba pa dang ska rags dag gi bgo ba la sogs pa la yongs su longs spyad na'o //üîΩsde pa gzhan gyi ni yang rung bar bya mi dgos pa nyid yin no //üîΩkhyim pas bskus pa la yang mi dgos so //üîΩkha dog chen por kha bsgyur ba'i gos bsten par mi bya'o //
analyzed: bsnyil ba sdud pa'i ltung byed do / // / sngon po'am dmar po'am ngur smrig gis kha ma bsgyur ba rang gi gos tha na lhung bzed kyi kha g-yogs dang snod dang rkang pa'i 'bo ba pa dang ska rags dag gi bgo ba la sogs pa la yongs su longs spyad na'o // sde pa gzhan gyi ni yang rung bar bya mi dgos pa nyid yin no // khyim pas bskus pa la yang mi dgos so // kha dog chen por kha bsgyur ba'i gos bsten par mi bya'o //
translated: The downfall is accrued by the monk who does not make an effort to stop him.

original: khyim pa'i gos kyang mi bya'o //
analyzed: khyim pa'i gos kyang mi bya'o //
translated: If he uses the robes, begging bowl, or other belongings of a novice monk who has been expelled, or if he uses the robes of a monk who has been expelled, or who has disrobed, or who has changed his status, or who has become a novice monk again, or who has been suspended, or who has been expelled from the monastery, or who has been asked to leave, or who has been declared to be insane, or who has been declared to be a hermaphrodite, or who has been expelled for not recognizing an offense, or who has been expelled for not making amends for an offense, or who has been expelled for not giving up a bad view, or who has been expelled for not giving up his claim that he has seen, heard, or thought something that he has not seen, heard, or thought, or who has been expelled for not giving up his claim that he has seen, heard, or thought something that he has not seen, heard, or thought, or who has been expelled for not giving up his claim that he has seen, heard, or thought something that he has not seen, heard, or thought, or who has been expelled for not giving up his claim that he has seen, heard, or thought something that he has not seen, heard, or thought, or who has been expelled for not giving up his claim that he has seen, heard, or thought something that he has not seen, heard, or thought, or who has been expelled for not giving up his claim that he has seen, heard, or thought something that he has not seen, heard, or thought, or who has been expelled for not giving up his claim that he has seen, heard, or thought something that he has not seen, heard, or thought, or who has been expelled for not giving up his claim that he has seen, heard, or thought something that he has not seen, heard, or thought, or who has been expelled for not giving up his claim that he has seen, heard, or thought something that he has not seen, heard, or thought, or who has been expelled for

original: gtsug lag khang gi nang du ngur smrig gis g-yogs te bsten par bya'o //
analyzed: gtsug lag khang gi nang du ngur smrig gis g-yogs te bsten par bya'o //
translated: He should enter the monastery wearing the saffron robes.

original: lam du gos brnyas pa ni thun mong nyid do //üîΩgrogs dge dang ngo //
analyzed: lam du gos brnyas pa ni thun mong nyid do // grogs dge dang ngo //
translated: The common rule is that he should not enter the village wearing the robes of another.üîΩHe should have virtuous friends.

original: dge slong dang dge tshul dag dang ngo //
analyzed: dge slong dang dge tshul dag dang ngo //
translated: He should have monks and novices as friends.

original: gcig nyid yin na rgan rabs nas brtsams te ji srid du sleb pa'i steng du g-yogs so //
analyzed: gcig nyid yin na rgan rabs nas brtsams te ji srid du sleb pa'i steng du g-yogs so //
translated: If he is alone, he should put on the robes, beginning with the upper robe, in the presence of an image of the Tathagata, a stupa, or a fellow monk.

original: dmigs kyis ma bsngos na gzhan las gyon te bcag par mi bya'o //
analyzed: dmigs kyis ma bsngos na gzhan las gyon te bcag par mi bya'o //
translated: If he has no other robes, he may wear the robes of another monk, but he should not tear them.

original: bsod nams 'dod pas mgron du @42b bos na kha tshar ma bcad pa man chad sar pa la ni mi rtag pas nyen par 'gyur ba'i yid la byed pas steng du brdzi bar bya'o //
analyzed: bsod nams 'dod pas mgron du @42b bos na kha tshar ma bcad pa man chad sar pa la ni mi rtag pas nyen par 'gyur ba'i yid la byed pas steng du brdzi bar bya'o //
translated: If he is invited to a meal by someone who desires merit, he should step over the threshold with the thought that the robes are impermanent.

original: kha ma bsgyur ba'i gos gyon pa'i ltung byed do /
analyzed: kha ma bsgyur ba'i gos gyon pa'i ltung byed do /
translated: The offense of wearing a robe that has not been cut is ended.

original: // / rin po che rang gi ma yin pa dang der smos pa la reg gam reg tu bcug na byed pa po yin no //
analyzed: // / rin po che rang gi ma yin pa dang der smos pa la reg gam reg tu bcug na byed pa po yin no //
translated: If one touches or causes another to touch precious things that are not one‚Äôs own or that are not mentioned, one commits an offense.

original: de ni g-yul du bcad pa'i mtshon cha dang rol mor spyad pa'i lag cha'o //
analyzed: de ni g-yul du bcad pa'i mtshon cha dang rol mor spyad pa'i lag cha'o //
translated: Precious things are weapons in battle and musical instruments.

original: dgos pa'i phyir rung ba nyid du gyur pa ni dngos gzhi'o //
analyzed: dgos pa'i phyir rung ba nyid du gyur pa ni dngos gzhi'o //
translated: The basic transgression is to use it for one‚Äôs own needs when it is suitable to do so.

original: gyur pa ma yin pa ni nyes byas kyi'o //
analyzed: gyur pa ma yin pa ni nyes byas kyi'o //
translated: The secondary offense is to use it when it is not suitable.

original: gtsug lag khang dang de'i nye 'khor na 'dug pa la bdag gir bya ba dang ma 'brel par rdzas chud mi za bar bya ba'i sems kyis ni ma gtogs so //
analyzed: gtsug lag khang dang de'i nye 'khor na 'dug pa la bdag gir bya ba dang ma 'brel par rdzas chud mi za bar bya ba'i sems kyis ni ma gtogs so //
translated: This does not apply if one is staying in a monastery or its vicinity, and one has the intention of not wasting the property, but not the intention of making it one‚Äôs own.

original: de yal bar mi dor ro //
analyzed: de yal bar mi dor ro //
translated: One should not abandon it.

original: de zhag bdun nam brgyad du bsdu skyog bya'o //
analyzed: de zhag bdun nam brgyad du bsdu skyog bya'o //
translated: One should keep it for seven or eight days.

original: 'gro ba'i lam g-yogs su sa'am lo ma'i tshogs dag gis g-yogs par bya'o //
analyzed: 'gro ba'i lam g-yogs su sa'am lo ma'i tshogs dag gis g-yogs par bya'o //
translated: One should cover it with grass or leaves on the road one will travel.

original: bdag po rtags thams cad la ma bstabs par kho bo'i yin no zhes zer ba la sbyin par mi bya'o ;
analyzed: bdag po rtags thams cad la ma bstabs par kho bo'i yin no zhes zer ba la sbyin par mi bya'o ;
translated: If the owner says, ‚ÄúIt is mine,‚Äù one should not give it to him unless he gives a sign.

original: 'ongs par ma gyur na de'i 'og tu dge 'dun gyi mdzod du gzhug par ba'o //
analyzed: 'ongs par ma gyur na de'i 'og tu dge 'dun gyi mdzod du gzhug par ba'o //
translated: If he does not come, one should put it in the Sangha‚Äôs storehouse.

original: zla ba drug gi mtha' tshun chad du bcang bar bya'o //
analyzed: zla ba drug gi mtha' tshun chad du bcang bar bya'o //
translated: One should keep it for six months at most.

original: de'i 'og tu ma 'ongs na sangs rgyas sam dge 'dun gyi ris gang nas rnyed pa der spyad du rung ngo //
analyzed: de'i 'og tu ma 'ongs na sangs rgyas sam dge 'dun gyi ris gang nas rnyed pa der spyad du rung ngo //
translated: If the owner does not come after that, it is suitable to use it in the place where it was found, either for the Buddha or for the Sangha.

original: de rung ba nyid ma yin na des rung ba brtan po nyo bar bya'o //
analyzed: de rung ba nyid ma yin na des rung ba brtan po nyo bar bya'o //
translated: If it is not suitable, then one should buy a suitable one.

original: gal te de'i tshe bdag po 'ongs par gyur na rjes su gnang ba gsol te mi ster na sbyin par bya'o //
analyzed: gal te de'i tshe bdag po 'ongs par gyur na rjes su gnang ba gsol te mi ster na sbyin par bya'o //
translated: If the owner comes at that time, one should ask for his permission. If he does not give it, one should give it back.

original: gal te skyed slong na kho bo cag gis yongs su bskyang ba gang yin pa de nyid drin che bar mi sems sam zhes brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: gal te skyed slong na kho bo cag gis yongs su bskyang ba gang yin pa de nyid drin che bar mi sems sam zhes brjod par bya'o //
translated: If he demands interest, one should say: ‚ÄúDo you not think that I have already shown you great kindness by taking care of it?‚Äù

original: nor bu la sogs pa la ni bdar ba dang phugs pa nyid du rung ba nyid yin no //
analyzed: nor bu la sogs pa la ni bdar ba dang phugs pa nyid du rung ba nyid yin no //
translated: As for jewels, etc., it is suitable to sell them after having them appraised.

original: mgul rgyan dang gdu bu rgyan can dang dpung rgyan dang do shal dang se mo do nyid du gnas pa yang ngo //üîΩpi wang dang 'od ma dang bal la ri dang ma ha ti dang su gho sha rnams ni rgyud dang bcas pa nyid na'o //
analyzed: mgul rgyan dang gdu bu rgyan can dang dpung rgyan dang do shal dang se mo do nyid du gnas pa yang ngo // pi wang dang 'od ma dang bal la ri dang ma ha ti dang su gho sha rnams ni rgyud dang bcas pa nyid na'o //
translated: Necklaces, bracelets, armlets, strings of precious stones, and pearl necklaces are to be kept.üîΩLutes, flutes, guitars, and drums are to be kept if they are part of a set.

original: dung dang rnga bo che dang rnga pa ta ha dang rdza rnga rnams ni sgra 'byin na'o //
analyzed: dung dang rnga bo che dang rnga pa ta ha dang rdza rnga rnams ni sgra 'byin na'o //
translated: Conches, kettledrums, pa·π≠aha drums, and clay drums are to be kept if they are used to make sounds.

original: gzhu ni rgyud dang bcas pa nyid na'o //
analyzed: gzhu ni rgyud dang bcas pa nyid na'o //
translated: Bows are to be kept if they are part of a set.

original: ral gri dang ral gri kyog po dang ral gri so gcig pa dang 'phang mdung dang mdung dang lcags kyo rnams ni de dag nyid yin na'o //
analyzed: ral gri dang ral gri kyog po dang ral gri so gcig pa dang 'phang mdung dang mdung dang lcags kyo rnams ni de dag nyid yin na'o //
translated: The sword, the crooked sword, the single-edged sword, the spear, the lance, and the iron chain are just as they are known in the world.

original: mda' dang lcags mda' dang mda' phyed lcags las byas pa rnams ni mde'u dang bcas pa @43a * //
analyzed: mda' dang lcags mda' dang mda' phyed lcags las byas pa rnams ni mde'u dang bcas pa @43a * //
translated: The arrow, the iron arrow, and the half-arrow are made of iron and are equipped with feathers.

original: nyid na'o ; / sku gzugs ni sku gdung dang bcas pa nyid na'o //
analyzed: nyid na'o ; / sku gzugs ni sku gdung dang bcas pa nyid na'o //
translated: The image is made of relics.

original: de la ston pa'i 'du shes nye bar gzhag na nyes pa med do //
analyzed: de la ston pa'i 'du shes nye bar gzhag na nyes pa med do //
translated: There is no offense if one has the perception of the Teacher.

original: nor bu mching bu dang sog ma'i phreng ba dang mchu sbrang dang rdza rnga kha gcig pa dang gzhu dang mda' ltar bcos pa rnams ni phyed nyid do ;
analyzed: nor bu mching bu dang sog ma'i phreng ba dang mchu sbrang dang rdza rnga kha gcig pa dang gzhu dang mda' ltar bcos pa rnams ni phyed nyid do ;
translated: The imitation of the lapis lazuli, the imitation of the bamboo, the imitation of the beak of a parrot, the imitation of the one-sided drum, the imitation of the bow, and the imitation of the arrow are half.

original: / gser gyi stegs bu ni mi rung ba nyid do //
analyzed: / gser gyi stegs bu ni mi rung ba nyid do //
translated: The golden bridge is not suitable.üîΩIf there is danger, one should take the wealth and gold of the Sa·πÖgha and of the st≈´pa and go.

original: 'jigs par gyur na drang gi la mi gnod na dge 'dun gyi dang mchod rten gyi dbyig dang gser sbas nas sam khyer te 'gro bar bya'o //
analyzed: 'jigs par gyur na drang gi la mi gnod na dge 'dun gyi dang mchod rten gyi dbyig dang gser sbas nas sam khyer te 'gro bar bya'o //
translated: If there is no danger, one should hide it or take it away.

original: dad pa can nam dge tshul gyis so //
analyzed: dad pa can nam dge tshul gyis so //
translated: One should do it with faith or with a novice monk.

original: med na rang gis so //
analyzed: med na rang gis so //
translated: If not, he should do it himself.

original: der bsko bar bya'o //
analyzed: der bsko bar bya'o //
translated: He should appoint someone to do it.

original: bral na sbyin no //
analyzed: bral na sbyin no //
translated: If he is not free, he should give it.

original: bru ba yang de dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: bru ba yang de dang 'dra'o //
translated: The same applies to digging.

original: mi ma yin pa'i gnas na gal te de dag gi bsod nams kyis byung ba rin po che'i rang bzhin gyi sa gzhi dang them skas la sogs pa la ni nyes pa med do //
analyzed: mi ma yin pa'i gnas na gal te de dag gi bsod nams kyis byung ba rin po che'i rang bzhin gyi sa gzhi dang them skas la sogs pa la ni nyes pa med do //
translated: In the abode of non-human beings, if it is a precious substance arisen from their merit, such as a jeweled ground or staircase, there is no fault.

original: zan gyi phyir snod gzhan med na rin po che las byas pa yang ngo //
analyzed: zan gyi phyir snod gzhan med na rin po che las byas pa yang ngo //
translated: If there is no other vessel for food, it is also for one made of precious substances.

original: 'dug pa'i phyir mal cha dang stan la yang ngo //
analyzed: 'dug pa'i phyir mal cha dang stan la yang ngo //
translated: It is also for bedding and seats for sitting.

original: bzhon pas 'gro bar bya'o //
analyzed: bzhon pas 'gro bar bya'o //
translated: One should go by vehicle.

original: chos dang ldan pa'i don gyi dbang nyid kyis so //
analyzed: chos dang ldan pa'i don gyi dbang nyid kyis so //
translated: By the power of the meaning of the Dharma itself.

original: cha sgeg dang ldan pa nyid kyis mi bya'o //
analyzed: cha sgeg dang ldan pa nyid kyis mi bya'o //
translated: One should not do it by mere attachment to beauty.

original: rgas pa dang na bdag las gzhan pas mi bya'o //
analyzed: rgas pa dang na bdag las gzhan pas mi bya'o //
translated: One should not do it by one who is other than old and sick.

original: chos nyan du gzhug pa'i phyir rin po che las byas pa'i seng ge'i khri la mi rtag pas nyen par 'gyur ba'i yid la byed pas 'dug par bya'o //
analyzed: chos nyan du gzhug pa'i phyir rin po che las byas pa'i seng ge'i khri la mi rtag pas nyen par 'gyur ba'i yid la byed pas 'dug par bya'o //
translated: In order to make them listen to the Dharma, one should sit on a precious lion throne with the attention of being afflicted by impermanence.

original: khyim gzhan du des bshams pa na gser dang dngul gyis sbras pa dril bu g-yer kas bshigs pa'i gos dag la khyim pa'i yin no snyam du shes par byas nas kyang ngo //
analyzed: khyim gzhan du des bshams pa na gser dang dngul gyis sbras pa dril bu g-yer kas bshigs pa'i gos dag la khyim pa'i yin no snyam du shes par byas nas kyang ngo //
translated: If he is in another's house, and the other's wife is dressed in garments embroidered with gold and silver and tinkling ornaments, he should think that they are the wife of another and touch her.

original: de la nor bus sbras pa gser dang dngul gyis brgyan pa dag la yang ngo //
analyzed: de la nor bus sbras pa gser dang dngul gyis brgyan pa dag la yang ngo //
translated: If they are embroidered with gems, he should think that they are decorated with gold and silver.

original: de dag brub par bya'o //
analyzed: de dag brub par bya'o //
translated: He should break them.

original: khyim pa dang dge tshul med na sangs rgyas kyi sku gzugs la ston pa'i 'du shes nye bar gzhag pa rnams kyis chos dang ldan pa'i don gyi dbang nyid kyis reg pa la mi rung ba nyid med do ;
analyzed: khyim pa dang dge tshul med na sangs rgyas kyi sku gzugs la ston pa'i 'du shes nye bar gzhag pa rnams kyis chos dang ldan pa'i don gyi dbang nyid kyis reg pa la mi rung ba nyid med do ;
translated: If there is no householder or novice, there is no fault in touching the image of the Buddha, because he has the idea of the Teacher, and because of the power of the Dharma.

original: / de'i rdzas la yang ngo //
analyzed: / de'i rdzas la yang ngo //
translated: He should also do this with the materials of the image.

original: rgyan gdags pa bsten par mi bya'o //
analyzed: rgyan gdags pa bsten par mi bya'o //
translated: He should not wear ornaments.

original: rgya bcang bar bya'o //
analyzed: rgya bcang bar bya'o //
translated: He should carry a staff.

original: gdags su mi rung ba'o //
analyzed: gdags su mi rung ba'o //
translated: It is not suitable to wear.

original: ro nye'am zangs sam ra gan nam khar ba'am rgya skyegs kyi tshigs ma'am shing ngam rdo'am sa'am ba so'am rva dag las byas pa'o //
analyzed: ro nye'am zangs sam ra gan nam khar ba'am rgya skyegs kyi tshigs ma'am shing ngam rdo'am sa'am ba so'am rva dag las byas pa'o //
translated: It is made of bone, ivory, horn, wood, stone, bamboo, or metal.

original: rtags ni dge @43b 'dun gyi la ni dbus su 'khor lo ngos gnyis su ri dags 'og tu gtsug lag khang gi bdag po'i ming bri'o //
analyzed: rtags ni dge @43b 'dun gyi la ni dbus su 'khor lo ngos gnyis su ri dags 'og tu gtsug lag khang gi bdag po'i ming bri'o //
translated: The sign of the monk‚Äôs robe is that on the central panel there is a wheel with two deer below it, and the name of the owner of the monastery is written.

original: gang zag gi la ni rus pa'i keng rus sam mgo'i thod pa'o //
analyzed: gang zag gi la ni rus pa'i keng rus sam mgo'i thod pa'o //
translated: The sign of the individual‚Äôs robe is a skeleton or a skull.

original: so mangs kyis skra bshad par mi bya'o //
analyzed: so mangs kyis skra bshad par mi bya'o //
translated: One should not comb one‚Äôs hair with a comb.

original: de ni dpe'o //
analyzed: de ni dpe'o //
translated: That is the simile.

original: me long gis bzhin blta bar mi bya'o ;üîΩ/ chu yan chad kyis so //
analyzed: me long gis bzhin blta bar mi bya'o ; / chu yan chad kyis so //
translated: One should not look at one‚Äôs face in a mirror.üîΩOne should not look at one‚Äôs face in water.

original: chu brtag pa'i ched nyid dang gnyer ma dang rma dang skra dkar blta ba dang snga phyi'i mtshan ma gzung ba la ni nyes pa med do //
analyzed: chu brtag pa'i ched nyid dang gnyer ma dang rma dang skra dkar blta ba dang snga phyi'i mtshan ma gzung ba la ni nyes pa med do //
translated: There is no offense if one looks at wrinkles, wounds, or gray hairs, or if one looks at the reflection in order to determine whether or not the water is suitable for drinking, or to determine the time of day, or to determine the direction.

original: 'phral ris gsum bsten par mi bya'o //
analyzed: 'phral ris gsum bsten par mi bya'o //
translated: One should not apply collyrium three times a day.

original: gi wang gis bsku ba bsten par mi bya'o //
analyzed: gi wang gis bsku ba bsten par mi bya'o //
translated: One should not apply a paste of betel nut.

original: dri dag gis kyang mi bya'o ;
analyzed: dri dag gis kyang mi bya'o ;
translated: One should not apply perfume.

original: / bsod nams 'dod pas rkang pa gnyis la lus bsku ba'i dris skud pa bsten par mi bya'o //
analyzed: / bsod nams 'dod pas rkang pa gnyis la lus bsku ba'i dris skud pa bsten par mi bya'o //
translated: One should not apply perfume to one‚Äôs feet out of a desire for merit.

original: de'i mdun du dor par mi bya'o //
analyzed: de'i mdun du dor par mi bya'o //
translated: One should not spit in front of a preceptor or an instructor.

original: de dag bskus pa dge 'dun gyi nang du 'du bar mi bya'o //
analyzed: de dag bskus pa dge 'dun gyi nang du 'du bar mi bya'o //
translated: He should not enter the Sa·πÖgha while wearing them.

original: khyim bdag la chos bstan par mi bya'o //
analyzed: khyim bdag la chos bstan par mi bya'o //
translated: He should not teach the Dharma to householders.

original: khyim bdag tu 'gro bar mi bya'o ;
analyzed: khyim bdag tu 'gro bar mi bya'o ;
translated: He should not go to the house of a householder.

original: / mjug tu khrus bya'o //
analyzed: / mjug tu khrus bya'o //
translated: He should wash at the end.

original: de dag blang bar bya'o //
analyzed: de dag blang bar bya'o //
translated: He should take them.

original: phreng ba rgyu dag kyang ngo //
analyzed: phreng ba rgyu dag kyang ngo //
translated: He should also take garlands and strings.

original: mchod rten la dbul bar bya'o //
analyzed: mchod rten la dbul bar bya'o //
translated: He should offer them to the st≈´pa.

original: nyan thos kyi la yang ngo //
analyzed: nyan thos kyi la yang ngo //
translated: He should also offer them to the ≈õrƒÅvakas.

original: sbyin par byed pa mngon par ma dad na mgo logs sam rkang pa logs su'o //
analyzed: sbyin par byed pa mngon par ma dad na mgo logs sam rkang pa logs su'o //
translated: If the giver is not respectful, he should offer them to the side of the head or the side of the foot.

original: sgo'i byang sted ma yin par bya'o //
analyzed: sgo'i byang sted ma yin par bya'o //
translated: He should not offer them to the top of the door.

original: rtsig pa la'o ;
analyzed: rtsig pa la'o ;
translated: He should offer them to the wall.

original: / der khab bam tsher ma btsugs pa la me tog phreng rgyud dag bcang bar bya'o //
analyzed: / der khab bam tsher ma btsugs pa la me tog phreng rgyud dag bcang bar bya'o //
translated: He should hang the garlands and strings on a pin or thorn stuck there.

original: mig la phan pa'i dri zhim po dus dus su bsnam par bya'o //
analyzed: mig la phan pa'i dri zhim po dus dus su bsnam par bya'o //
translated: He should smell from time to time fragrant substances that are good for the eyes.

original: bram ze'i srad bu thogs pa bsten par mi bya'o //
analyzed: bram ze'i srad bu thogs pa bsten par mi bya'o //
translated: He should not rely on those who wear the brahmin thread.

original: sngags skud kyang ngo //
analyzed: sngags skud kyang ngo //
translated: He should also not wear a mantra thread.

original: gso ba'i phyir ni dpung ba g-yon par ro //
analyzed: gso ba'i phyir ni dpung ba g-yon par ro //
translated: If it is for healing, he should wear it on his left arm.

original: gar bab bab tu mi dor ro //
analyzed: gar bab bab tu mi dor ro //
translated: He should not throw it away wherever he happens to be.

original: gal te lhag ma dang bcas par gyur na chos gos kyi tha ma 'am ska rags la gdags par bya'o //
analyzed: gal te lhag ma dang bcas par gyur na chos gos kyi tha ma 'am ska rags la gdags par bya'o //
translated: If there is a remainder, it should be attached to the end of the robe or to the belt.

original: gal te ma gyur na ka ba'am rtsig pa'i gseb tu gzhug go //
analyzed: gal te ma gyur na ka ba'am rtsig pa'i gseb tu gzhug go //
translated: If there is no remainder, it should be put between a pillar and the wall.

original: gar dang glu dang rol mo kun tu spyad par mi bya'o //
analyzed: gar dang glu dang rol mo kun tu spyad par mi bya'o //
translated: One should not engage in dance, song, or music.

original: bslab par mi bya'o //
analyzed: bslab par mi bya'o //
translated: One should not study.

original: bzlas par mi bya'o ;
analyzed: bzlas par mi bya'o ;
translated: One should not recite.

original: / blta ba'i phyir 'gro bar mi bya'o //
analyzed: / blta ba'i phyir 'gro bar mi bya'o //
translated: One should not go to see.

original: dge slong ma kun tu gar byed du mi gzhug go //
analyzed: dge slong ma kun tu gar byed du mi gzhug go //
translated: One should not allow nuns to dance.

original: ston pa'i yon tan yang dag par bsgrags pa dang / rgyun chags gsum pa gdon pa la dbyangs kyi nga ro bya'o //
analyzed: ston pa'i yon tan yang dag par bsgrags pa dang / rgyun chags gsum pa gdon pa la dbyangs kyi nga ro bya'o //
translated: One should chant with a melodious voice the proclamation of the qualities of the Teacher and the recitation of the third section.

original: de dag dben pa'i phyogs su bslab bar bya'o //üîΩmtho 'tshams @44a * //üîΩpa dang kun du rtse ba dang kun tu ca co 'don pa dang rgod pa dang dregs pa dang lus la rdeg pa dag mi bya'o //
analyzed: de dag dben pa'i phyogs su bslab bar bya'o // mtho 'tshams @44a * // pa dang kun du rtse ba dang kun tu ca co 'don pa dang rgod pa dang dregs pa dang lus la rdeg pa dag mi bya'o //
translated: One should train in a solitary place.üîΩOne should not be quarrelsome, playful, noisy, frivolous, haughty, or strike one‚Äôs body.

original: rgod pa'i bsam pas lus dang ngag gi rnam par 'gyur ba mi bya'o //
analyzed: rgod pa'i bsam pas lus dang ngag gi rnam par 'gyur ba mi bya'o //
translated: One should not move one‚Äôs body or voice with a frivolous attitude.

original: 'dres pa ni char sdom mo //
analyzed: 'dres pa ni char sdom mo //
translated: ‚ÄúMixed‚Äù means combined.

original: snod brgyud pas zas kyi bya ba mi bya'o //üîΩme tog rna rgyan brgyu bar mi bya'o //
analyzed: snod brgyud pas zas kyi bya ba mi bya'o // me tog rna rgyan brgyu bar mi bya'o //
translated: One should not use food that has passed through a container.üîΩOne should not string flowers together.

original: gdags par mi bya'o //
analyzed: gdags par mi bya'o //
translated: One should not make garlands.

original: ngo so las byung ba sbyin par mi bya'o //üîΩmi rings par rgyug par mi bya'o //
analyzed: ngo so las byung ba sbyin par mi bya'o // mi rings par rgyug par mi bya'o //
translated: One should not give a gift out of a desire for fame.üîΩOne should not run in a hurry.

original: myur ba dang mchongs pa mi bya'o //
analyzed: myur ba dang mchongs pa mi bya'o //
translated: One should not run fast or jump.

original: brla dang lag pa dang nya ltar skor ba bskor bar mi bya'o //
analyzed: brla dang lag pa dang nya ltar skor ba bskor bar mi bya'o //
translated: One should not walk with one‚Äôs knees knocking together, with one‚Äôs arms akimbo, or with one‚Äôs hands on one‚Äôs hips.

original: chur gseg ma gdags par mi bya'o //
analyzed: chur gseg ma gdags par mi bya'o //
translated: One should not throw sand into the water.

original: chur rdza rnga kha gcig pa dang rnga po che ltar brdung bar mi bya'o //
analyzed: chur rdza rnga kha gcig pa dang rnga po che ltar brdung bar mi bya'o //
translated: One should not play in the water like a potter‚Äôs wheel or a bherƒ´ drum.

original: rdza ba la phyi la mo nyug par mi bya'o //
analyzed: rdza ba la phyi la mo nyug par mi bya'o //
translated: One should not urinate or defecate in water.

original: glang po che'i skad dang rta'i skad dang khyu mchog gi skad dang rma bya'i skad dang khu byug gi skad mi dbyung ngo //
analyzed: glang po che'i skad dang rta'i skad dang khyu mchog gi skad dang rma bya'i skad dang khu byug gi skad mi dbyung ngo //
translated: One should not make the sounds of an elephant, a horse, a camel, a cow, a ram, a monkey, a peacock, a cuckoo, or a goose.

original: khas dung dang sil krol dang rnga bo che'i skad mi bya'o //
analyzed: khas dung dang sil krol dang rnga bo che'i skad mi bya'o //
translated: One should not make the sounds of a conch, a flute, or a bherƒ´ drum.

original: longs pa'i gzhir gtogs pa'i ltung byed do /
analyzed: longs pa'i gzhir gtogs pa'i ltung byed do /
translated: (This concludes) the chapter on the downfalls that are non-transgressions in the case of those who are impaired.

original: // /'dul pa'i mdo bam po lnga pa /
analyzed: // /'dul pa'i mdo bam po lnga pa /
translated: The summary of the Vinaya, fifth fascicle.

original: so ga rnams kyi zla ba lhag ma phyed dang gnyis dang / dbyar rnams kyi dang po las so //
analyzed: so ga rnams kyi zla ba lhag ma phyed dang gnyis dang / dbyar rnams kyi dang po las so //
translated: One and a half months remaining of spring, and the first of the rainy season.

original: gos med pa'i zas gnyis pa rnyed pa'i rnam pa gang yin pa la'o //
analyzed: gos med pa'i zas gnyis pa rnyed pa'i rnam pa gang yin pa la'o //
translated: In the case of obtaining a second meal without clothes.

original: rlung gis mi bskyod pa la'o //
analyzed: rlung gis mi bskyod pa la'o //
translated: In what is not shaken by the wind.

original: gos kyi grva bsgul ba ni de'i mtha' yin no //
analyzed: gos kyi grva bsgul ba ni de'i mtha' yin no //
translated: The edge of the robe is its end.

original: char gyis ma phog pa la'o //
analyzed: char gyis ma phog pa la'o //
translated: In what is not struck by rain.

original: de'i thigs pa gnyis kyis phog pa'o //
analyzed: de'i thigs pa gnyis kyis phog pa'o //
translated: Struck by two drops of it.

original: lus la'o // gzhan gyi dus su khrus kyi nyin mo ma yin pa zhag bco lnga'i mdun rol du khrus byed na'o //
analyzed: lus la'o // gzhan gyi dus su khrus kyi nyin mo ma yin pa zhag bco lnga'i mdun rol du khrus byed na'o //
translated: On the body. If one bathes before the fifteen days in the period of others, on a day that is not a bathing day.

original: dbang bskur bas sam 'jug pas so //
analyzed: dbang bskur bas sam 'jug pas so //
translated: By consecration or by entering.

original: lte bar son na'o //
analyzed: lte bar son na'o //
translated: If it reaches the navel.

original: mdun rol du ni nyes byas so //
analyzed: mdun rol du ni nyes byas so //
translated: A minor offense before.

original: chu ma yin pas kyang ngo //
analyzed: chu ma yin pas kyang ngo //
translated: Even with water that is not.

original: thams cad la dus dag yod kyang byin gyis ma brlabs na'o //
analyzed: thams cad la dus dag yod kyang byin gyis ma brlabs na'o //
translated: Even though there are times for all, if it is not consecrated.

original: don gzhan la gzhol bas chu nyams su myong ba ni khrus ma yin no //
analyzed: don gzhan la gzhol bas chu nyams su myong ba ni khrus ma yin no //
translated: Experiencing water while focused on another meaning is not bathing.

original: de'i phyir ma bsams par brgal ba dang rkyal pa la gdab pa dag la ni ltung ba med do //
analyzed: de'i phyir ma bsams par brgal ba dang rkyal pa la gdab pa dag la ni ltung ba med do //
translated: Therefore, there is no offense if one does not think about it, or if one is joking.

original: aa mra pa ran ta'i yul dag na ni 'di med par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: aa mra pa ran ta'i yul dag na ni 'di med par shes par bya'o //
translated: In the countries of Aparaanta, it is known that this is not an offense.

original: cho ga btsan po yod na bag yangs su bya ba la brten par mi bya'o //
analyzed: cho ga btsan po yod na bag yangs su bya ba la brten par mi bya'o //
translated: If there is a strong rule, one should not rely on the freedom.

original: khrus byed pa'i ltung byed do /
analyzed: khrus byed pa'i ltung byed do /
translated: This is the downfall of bathing.

original: // / gsod pa'i sems kyis dud 'gro la bsnun na'o //
analyzed: // / gsod pa'i sems kyis dud 'gro la bsnun na'o //
translated: If one kills an animal with the intention to kill,

original: gzhi des de'i tshe'am gzhan gyi tshe shi na'o //
analyzed: gzhi des de'i tshe'am gzhan gyi tshe shi na'o //
translated: and it dies at that time or later because of that.

original: sems @44b can gyi gzugs sems can ma yin pa la ni nyes byas byed pa nyid do //
analyzed: sems @44b can gyi gzugs sems can ma yin pa la ni nyes byas byed pa nyid do //
translated: If it is a living being that is not a sentient being, one commits an offense of wrong conduct.

original: dud 'gro gsod pa'i ltung byed do /
analyzed: dud 'gro gsod pa'i ltung byed do /
translated: This is the downfall of killing an animal.

original: // / khyod bsnyen par rdzogs pa ma yin zhing pham par 'gyur ba byung ngo zhes bya ba la sogs pa dge slong ma yin pa'i don gyis 'gyod pa bskyed na'o //
analyzed: // / khyod bsnyen par rdzogs pa ma yin zhing pham par 'gyur ba byung ngo zhes bya ba la sogs pa dge slong ma yin pa'i don gyis 'gyod pa bskyed na'o //
translated: If one says to a monk, ‚ÄúYou are not fully ordained, and you have committed an action that would be a defeat,‚Äù and so on, and makes him regret it by saying that he is not a monk,

original: dge slong la'o //
analyzed: dge slong la'o //
translated: to a monk.

original: bde ba la mi reg pa bskyed pa'i sems kyi'o //
analyzed: bde ba la mi reg pa bskyed pa'i sems kyi'o //
translated: With the thought that he will not experience bliss.

original: bzhad gad kyis kyang ngo //
analyzed: bzhad gad kyis kyang ngo //
translated: Even if it is a joke.

original: 'gyod pa ma skyes na yang ngo //üîΩgzhan gyis ni nyes byas so //
analyzed: 'gyod pa ma skyes na yang ngo // gzhan gyis ni nyes byas so //
translated: If he does not arouse regret, he is guilty of a transgression.

original: 'gyod pa bskyed pa'i ltung byed do /
analyzed: 'gyod pa bskyed pa'i ltung byed do /
translated: If he does arouse regret, he is guilty of a minor transgression.üîΩThe second Pataniya

original: // / dge slong la sor mo 'am khu tshur ram gru mo'am phrag pa'am mgo'am glo'am rgyab bam rked pa'am brla'am pus mo'am byin pa'am rkang ba'i mthe po la sogs pa dag gis ga ga tshil byed pas reg na'o //
analyzed: // / dge slong la sor mo 'am khu tshur ram gru mo'am phrag pa'am mgo'am glo'am rgyab bam rked pa'am brla'am pus mo'am byin pa'am rkang ba'i mthe po la sogs pa dag gis ga ga tshil byed pas reg na'o //
translated: If a Bhik·π£u, with his finger, or with his fist, or with his elbow, or with his shoulder, or with his head, or with his back, or with his waist, or with his thigh, or with his knee, or with his foot, or with some other part of his body, tickles another Bhik·π£u, whether he laughs or not, he becomes guilty of a Pataniya.

original: skyi g-ya' bar bya ba'i sems kyis so //
analyzed: skyi g-ya' bar bya ba'i sems kyis so //
translated: With the intention of tickling.

original: de'i phyir rma dang sbrang bu dang 'brum bu dang sme ba dang spu'i tshoms bstan pa la ni ltung ba med do //
analyzed: de'i phyir rma dang sbrang bu dang 'brum bu dang sme ba dang spu'i tshoms bstan pa la ni ltung ba med do //
translated: Therefore, there is no offense if he shows a wound, a mosquito-bite, a boil, a mole, or a hair.

original: reg byed gcig gam du ma nyid la'o //üîΩga ga tshil byed pa'i ltung byed do /
analyzed: reg byed gcig gam du ma nyid la'o // ga ga tshil byed pa'i ltung byed do /
translated: With one or several tangible things.üîΩThe third Pataniya

original: // / chu'i yul la rtse pa rjes su sgrub na'o //
analyzed: // / chu'i yul la rtse pa rjes su sgrub na'o //
translated: If a Bhik·π£u, in a place where there is water, should play in the water, he becomes guilty of a Pataniya.

original: zhugs shing nub pa dang 'byung ba dang ngogs gzhan du brgal ba dang rgyun phyogs dang rgyun las bzlog phyogs su rtsol ba dang chu la rnga bo che dang rdza rnga kha gcig pa'i sgra 'byin pa dang gse ba ma 'khrab pa dang 'phen pa dang khor yug
analyzed: zhugs shing nub pa dang 'byung ba dang ngogs gzhan du brgal ba dang rgyun phyogs dang rgyun las bzlog phyogs su rtsol ba dang chu la rnga bo che dang rdza rnga kha gcig pa'i sgra 'byin pa dang gse ba ma 'khrab pa dang 'phen pa dang khor yug
translated: If one enters the water, or sinks, or emerges, or crosses to the other bank, or exerts oneself in the direction of the current or against it, or makes the sound of a large drum or a one-sided drum, or dances the dance of a peacock, or throws oneself, or circles,

original: dang rdo rje dang khron pa dang dba' klong dang chu srubs 'dren pa dag byed na dngos gzhi'o //
analyzed: dang rdo rje dang khron pa dang dba' klong dang chu srubs 'dren pa dag byed na dngos gzhi'o //
translated: or makes a diamond, or a well, or a whirlpool, or a water-whirlpool, it is the actual basis.

original: bem rtol gyis brdegs na nyes byas so //
analyzed: bem rtol gyis brdegs na nyes byas so //
translated: If one strikes with a water-pot, it is an offense of wrong conduct.

original: bum pa dang phru ba dang ril ba dang kham phor dang bu ram gyi khu ba 'dzag pa dang sran chos dang 'u sha dang thang tsha ba nyid yod pa la yang ngo //
analyzed: bum pa dang phru ba dang ril ba dang kham phor dang bu ram gyi khu ba 'dzag pa dang sran chos dang 'u sha dang thang tsha ba nyid yod pa la yang ngo //
translated: Also, if there is a pot, a basin, a water-pot, a bowl, a container for molasses, a container for beans, a container for vegetables, or a container for hot water.

original: chu ma yin pa la rtse ba yang ngo //
analyzed: chu ma yin pa la rtse ba yang ngo //
translated: Also, if one plays in that which is not water.

original: de lta bu la byed du bcug pa ni de dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: de lta bu la byed du bcug pa ni de dang 'dra'o //
translated: If one makes another do such things, it is the same.

original: rgod pas dga' ba nyams su myong bar bya ba'i 'dun pas so //
analyzed: rgod pas dga' ba nyams su myong bar bya ba'i 'dun pas so //
translated: If one does it with the intention of experiencing the pleasure of splashing.

original: de'i phyir sim par 'dod pas brgal ba la sogs pa la ni ltung ba med do //üîΩrkyal slob pa thad ka 'am lta 'og tu rtsol ba la yang ngo //
analyzed: de'i phyir sim par 'dod pas brgal ba la sogs pa la ni ltung ba med do // rkyal slob pa thad ka 'am lta 'og tu rtsol ba la yang ngo //
translated: Therefore, there is no offense if one is trying to cross a river and so on in order to escape from a danger.üîΩThere is no offense if one is learning to swim.

original: grangs par 'dod pas tsha ba dag la ri mo 'dod pa la yang ngo //
analyzed: grangs par 'dod pas tsha ba dag la ri mo 'dod pa la yang ngo //
translated: There is no offense if one is trying to draw water from a deep well.

original: chu la rtse ba'i ltung byed do /
analyzed: chu la rtse ba'i ltung byed do /
translated: The second rule: playing in waterüîΩThe second root downfall of a novice nun is to play in water.üîΩThe third rule: sleeping in the same place as a man

original: // / bud med dang lhan cig gnas gcig tu gnyid log na'o //
analyzed: // / bud med dang lhan cig gnas gcig tu gnyid log na'o //
translated: The third root downfall of a novice nun is to sleep in the same place as a man.

original: mtshan mo'o // mthar ro //üîΩmdun rol du ni nyes byas so//
analyzed: mtshan mo'o // mthar ro // mdun rol du ni nyes byas so//
translated: The fourth rule: laughing loudly

original: @45a * // bya gag ni tshad ni de byed pa nyid kyi mtha'o //
analyzed: @45a * // bya gag ni tshad ni de byed pa nyid kyi mtha'o //
translated: The fourth root downfall of a novice nun is to laugh loudly.

original: bud med dang lhan cig nyal ba'i ltung byed do /
analyzed: bud med dang lhan cig nyal ba'i ltung byed do /
translated: The fifth rule: sitting in private with a manüîΩThe fifth root downfall of a novice nun is to sit in private with a man.üîΩThe sixth rule: frightening a monk

original: // / bzhad gad bya bar bsams pas kyang rung ste sngangs bar 'dod pas 'jigs pa'i rgyu nye bar sgrub pa sngon du btang pas 'jigs par byed pa che ge mo zhig ces dge slong la gzhan gyis kyang go bar byed na 'jigs pa ma skyes kyang ngo //
analyzed: // / bzhad gad bya bar bsams pas kyang rung ste sngangs bar 'dod pas 'jigs pa'i rgyu nye bar sgrub pa sngon du btang pas 'jigs par byed pa che ge mo zhig ces dge slong la gzhan gyis kyang go bar byed na 'jigs pa ma skyes kyang ngo //
translated: The sixth root downfall of a novice nun is to frighten a monk.

original: yid du mi 'ong ba la dngos gzhi'o //
analyzed: yid du mi 'ong ba la dngos gzhi'o //
translated: The actual basis is the unpleasant.

original: 'di lta ste dper na yi dvags dang sha za dang grul bum pa dang lus sprul po'i gzugs la ba nag po dang sol ba dang ka ba dang ka ba tshig pa lta bu /
analyzed: 'di lta ste dper na yi dvags dang sha za dang grul bum pa dang lus sprul po'i gzugs la ba nag po dang sol ba dang ka ba dang ka ba tshig pa lta bu /
translated: For example, it is like the forms of ghosts, cannibals, and demons, like black cloth, charcoal, a pillar, or a burnt pillar.

original: seng ge dang stag dang gung dang bse dang gzig dang wa'i skad lta bu /üîΩbshang ba dang gci ba dang ra dang de'i zi ba'i dri lta bu /
analyzed: seng ge dang stag dang gung dang bse dang gzig dang wa'i skad lta bu / bshang ba dang gci ba dang ra dang de'i zi ba'i dri lta bu /
translated: It is like the sounds of a lion, tiger, leopard, rhinoceros, panther, or jackal.üîΩIt is like the smell of feces, urine, a goat, or a sheep.

original: seg dang re sde dang phyar ba'i reg pa lta bu dag nyid sgrogs pa'o //
analyzed: seg dang re sde dang phyar ba'i reg pa lta bu dag nyid sgrogs pa'o //
translated: It is like the touch of a saw, a razor, or a cloth.

original: yid du 'ong ba la ni nyes byas so //
analyzed: yid du 'ong ba la ni nyes byas so //
translated: The misdeed is the pleasant.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: For example,

original: dper na lha dang klu dang dri za dang gnod sbyin dang mi'am ci dang lto 'phye chen po'i gzugs nor can dang tshong dpon dang ded dpon la sogs pa lta bu dang / pi wang la sogs pa'i sgra lta bu /
analyzed: dper na lha dang klu dang dri za dang gnod sbyin dang mi'am ci dang lto 'phye chen po'i gzugs nor can dang tshong dpon dang ded dpon la sogs pa lta bu dang / pi wang la sogs pa'i sgra lta bu /
translated: it is like the forms of gods, nƒÅgas, gandharvas, yak·π£as, kinnaras, and mahoragas, like a wealthy man, a merchant, or a caravan leader. It is like the sound of a vƒ´·πáƒÅ.

original: aa ka ru dang can dan dang gur gum dang ta ma la'i lo ma'i dri lta bu /
analyzed: aa ka ru dang can dan dang gur gum dang ta ma la'i lo ma'i dri lta bu /
translated: It is like the smell of agarwood, sandalwood, saffron, or tamƒÅla leaves.

original: dang dang ras yug chen po dang be'u ras dang dar la dang du gu la'i ras dang ko ta ma pa'i ras kyi reg pa lta bu nyid sgrogs pa'o //
analyzed: dang dang ras yug chen po dang be'u ras dang dar la dang du gu la'i ras dang ko ta ma pa'i ras kyi reg pa lta bu nyid sgrogs pa'o //
translated: The exception is when it is to proclaim the pleasant touch of a woman, such as silk, fine cotton, wool, raw silk, linen, or cotton.

original: skyo bar bya ba'i ched nyid ni ma gtogs so //
analyzed: skyo bar bya ba'i ched nyid ni ma gtogs so //
translated: The exception is when it is to cause disgust.

original: de'i phyir skyo bar bya ba'i chod nyid du sems can dmyal ba dang dud 'gro dang yi dvags kyi gtam la sogs pa ni ltung ba med do //
analyzed: de'i phyir skyo bar bya ba'i chod nyid du sems can dmyal ba dang dud 'gro dang yi dvags kyi gtam la sogs pa ni ltung ba med do //
translated: Therefore, there is no offense in speaking about the hells, animals, and ghosts in order to cause disgust.

original: sngags par byed pa'i ltung byed do /
analyzed: sngags par byed pa'i ltung byed do /
translated: The downfall is to act as a magician.

original: // / rab tu byung ba 'di pa dbang ba'i ltung bzed dang / chos gos dang / dra ba dang / phor bu dang / ska ra gsal sogs pa dge sbyong gi 'tsho ba'i yo byad sbed dam sbed du bcug na'o //
analyzed: // / rab tu byung ba 'di pa dbang ba'i ltung bzed dang / chos gos dang / dra ba dang / phor bu dang / ska ra gsal sogs pa dge sbyong gi 'tsho ba'i yo byad sbed dam sbed du bcug na'o //

original: phan par 'dod pas ni ma gtogs so //
analyzed: phan par 'dod pas ni ma gtogs so //
translated: The exception is when it is to benefit the renunciate.

original: sbed pa'i ltung byed do /
analyzed: sbed pa'i ltung byed do /
translated: The downfall is to hide.

analyzed: // / dge slong la gos blang ba med par byin pa des gnang ba med par spyod na'o //

analyzed: gal te gzhi des de dga' bar mi 'gyur na'o // byin pas nye bar 'tsho ba'i ltung byed do /
